bill.title: Mental health; prohibit expenditure of state funds for adult services except for those adults with certain diagnoses.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-4-7 And 41-19-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, From And After January 1, 2011, The State Board Of Mental Health And The Regional Mental Health Commissions Shall Not Spend Any State Funds For Mental Health Services For Adults Except For Those Adults Who Have A Diagnosis Of A Severe And Persistent Mental Illness Such As Schizophrenia, Severe Major Depression, Bipolar Disorder, Or Other Severely Disabling Mental Disorder That Requires Crisis Resolution Or Ongoing And Long-term Support And Treatment; To Delete The Authority For Regional Mental Health/mental Retardation Commissions To Provide Services For The Problems Of Aging; To Provide That The State Board Of Mental Health, Rather Than The Department Of Mental Health, Shall Designate And Certify Certain Services That Are Provided By The Regional Commissions; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Human Services;Appropriations
